channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: 2024 Gambling Harm Awareness Week
item.description:
Sunday, August 4, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to support 2024 Gambling Harm Awareness Week.

Relationships Australia QLD is the predominate deliverer of the Gambling Help Service in Queensland. We work on prevention, early intervention, counselling, crisis support to reduce gambling harms in Queensland. Gambling Harm Awareness Week is held annually each year in late July to raise awareness.

This Light Up is organised by: Relationships Australia Qld

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Brisbane Lions AFLW Season Launch
item.description:
Monday, August 5, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue Gold Maroon to support 2024 Brisbane Lions AFLW Season Launch.

The Brisbane Lions AFLW team are our reigning premiers and as they embark on their Premiership defence, we want Brisbane to get behind them to help them in their chase.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Lions AFL Club

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: National Stroke Week
item.description:
Tuesday, August 6, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to support National Stroke Week.

National Stroke Week is Stroke Foundation's annual awareness campaign encouraging all Australians to take action to prevent, treat and be aware of stroke. The 2024 campaign focuses on encouraging people to recognise the F.A.S.T. (Face, Arm, Speech, Time) signs of stroke, and to call an ambulance immediately, thereby potentially saving a life.

This Light Up is organised by: National Stroke Foundation

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: National Eosinophilic Week (NEOSW)
item.description:
Wednesday, August 7, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink Purple to support National Eosinophilic Week (NEOSW).

National Eosinophilic Week (4-10 August 2024) by illuminating our landmarks pink and purple (the colours of eosinophils) to shine the light on eosinophilic diseases. Eosinophils are a type of white blood cell and this week raises important awareness for eosinophil-associated diseases including eosinophilic gastrointestinal diseases (EGIDs).

Find out more at https://eosaware.com.
#EOSLightUp #NEOSW2024 #EOSaware

This Light Up is organised by: ausEE

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of Singapore National Day
item.description:
Thursday, August 8, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and White to recognise the Eve of Singapore National Day.

Singapore National Day is celebrated on 9th August each year. The day marks Singapore's independence as a sovereign nation and 2024 marks Singapore's 59th year of independence.

This Light Up is organised by: Singapore Business Group

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Australian Wallabies v South Africa Springboks
item.description:
Saturday, August 10, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green and Gold to celebrate Australian Wallabies v South Africa Springboks.

Don’t miss this epic clash between the Wallabies and back-to-back Rugby World Cup Champions South Africa at Brisbane’s Suncorp Stadium. Kicking off the Rugby Championship, the Wallabies will be out to avenge their loss when the two last met in Australia whilst the Springboks will be ready to showcase why they’re the best in the world. A clash of the ages and one not to be missed - grab your family and friends and get involved in afternoon International Rugby at its best.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Ekka
item.description:
Sunday, August 11, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Green to celebrate Ekka.

The Royal Queensland Show (Ekka) is Queensland's largest annual event, bringing the country and city together since 1876. Over 9 full days from the 10th to the 18th of August 2024, this key event celebrates and champions agriculture and the critical role it plays in our everyday lives, including Peoples day on August 14.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 110 Years of Australian Red Cross
item.description:
Tuesday, August 13, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support 110 Years of Australian Red Cross.

Australian Red Cross is celebrating its 110th anniversary on 13 August 2024. Iconic landmarks across Australia are turning red to as a visible tribute to the people we have stood beside through crises, and a thank you to everyone who has helped make our vital work possible ? past, present and future. We hope that everyone who sees a beacon of red this August is reminded that the Australian Red Cross has always been there to help people in need.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Red Cross Society

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.description:

The Story Bridge will be lit White, Orange and Green to recognise India Independence Day.

item.title: Bullying No Way Week of Action
item.description:
Friday, August 16, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Bullying No Way Week of Action.

Bullying No Way, is a joint national project lead and managed by the Queensland Department of Education on behalf of all state and territory education jurisdictions (including Catholic and Independent schooling sectors).
We support Australian schools to counter bullying, harassment and violence through evidence-informed advice and resources, and initiatives such as the annual National Day of Action.

Bullying No Way Week of Action stands as Australia's premier school-led initiative combating bullying and violence. With 67% of Australian schools already registered, Bullying No Way Week has emerged as a cornerstone national event, garnering support from numerous community organisations nationwide.

This Light Up is organised by: Bullying No Way

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

Bullying No Way, is a joint national project lead and managed by the Queensland Department of Education on behalf of all state and territory education jurisdictions (including Catholic and Independent schooling sectors). We support Australian schools to counter bullying, harassment and violence through evidence-informed advice and resources, and initiatives such as the annual National Day of Action. Bullying No Way Week of Action stands as Australia's premier school-led initiative combating bullying and violence. With 67% of Australian schools already registered, Bullying No Way Week has emerged as a cornerstone national event, garnering support from numerous community organisations nationwide.

This Light Up is organised by: Bullying No Way

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Brain Injury Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, August 19, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Brain Injury Awareness Week.

The annual Brain Injury Awareness Week raises awareness of brain injuries and its impact. The week also celebrates the achievements of the 1 in 45 Australians living with a brain injury and the commitment given to them by their families and the communities they live in. Synapse provides a range of support services for people who have been impacted by a brain injury or disability. These services promote quality of life, self-determination, and choice through information, specialist support, and targeted research activities.

This Light Up is organised by: Synapes Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Tuesday, August 20, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit BrisFest Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane. We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.
This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Daffodil Day
item.description:
Thursday, August 22, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Daffodil Day.

Fundraise at home, in your workplace or community and give hope this Daffodil Day. The Cancer Council Queensland aims to lead Queenslanders in a partnership against Cancer. Cancer Council Queensland is here to support all Queenslanders affected by cancer by reducing cancer risk, improving early detection and improving the quality of life for Queenslanders impacted by a cancer diagnosis.

This Light Up is organised by: Cancer Council Queensland

item.title: 8 years until Brisbane 2032 Paralympics Games
item.description:
Saturday, August 24, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red, Blue, Green (Paralympic agitos) to celebrate 8 years until Brisbane 2032 Paralympics Games.

24 August 2024 marks 8 years to the start of the Brisbane 2032 Paralympic Games. The Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games will create a legacy that aligns with Council’s commitment to making the Brisbane of tomorrow even better than the Brisbane of today.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition
item.description:
Sunday, August 25, 2024

City Hall will be lit White, Blue, Yellow, Green and Black to recognise Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition.

The Australian South Sea Islander Day of National Recognition, celebrated on August 25th, marks the day that the Federal Government officially recognised Australian South Sea Islander (ASSI) as a distinct cultural group. The ASSI Community aims to recognise this culturally significant occasion's anniversary to increase recognition and raise awareness of our unique history and culture and to pay respect to our South Sea Islander Ancestors and Forebearers.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian South Sea Islanders United Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Queensland Road Safety Week
item.description:
Monday, August 26, 2024

City Hall will be lit Yellow to support Queensland Road Safety Week.

The 10th annual Queensland Road Safety Week aims to promote road safety for everyone, including drivers, passengers, riders and pedestrians. With 278 people sadly losing their lives on Queensland roads in 2023, it's more important than ever to focus on road safety, with key landmarks lit yellow as reminder.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Transport and Main Roads

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Fashion Festival
item.description:
Tuesday, August 27, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red, White, Blue and Yellow to celebrate Brisbane Fashion Festival.

Brisbane Fashion Festival 2024 will run with an expanded program and will be staged once again in the heart of The City. This annual event is designed to shine the spotlight on our vibrant city as we launch Spring/Summer to the rest of the country. The runway this year will again be staged in a spectacular custom-built marquee with a clear-span roof offering views of the iconic Brisbane City Hall, along with a specially designed set and tiered seating to accommodate 700 guests at each show.

This Light Up is organised by: Lindsay Bennett Marketing Pty Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
